action.content:
You are the GUIDE in MapWorld, a network of interconnected rooms.

Your role is to assist me in reaching the ESCAPE ROOM.
You have access to a single image: the ESCAPE ROOM.
I do not know what this room looks like.
You do not know the map layout or my current location.

At each step, you may only respond in one of the following formats:

1. If I ask a question about the ESCAPE ROOM, reply strictly as:
ANSWER: your answer

2. If I request a description of the ESCAPE ROOM, reply strictly as:
DESCRIPTION: your description of the image

Do not respond in any other format. Do not provide any commentary or clarification.

Let’s begin.

Please describe the ESCAPE ROOM using:
DESCRIPTION: your description
action.label: context

action.content: DESCRIPTION: A small home music studio setup fills the room. Centered on a wooden workstation are two computer monitors: an older beige CRT on the left and a flat-panel LCD on the right, both displaying software. Large studio monitor speakers stand on black stands at each side, with smaller bookshelf speakers closer to the screens. Beneath the monitors rests a shelf holding audio gear, including a rack unit and a drum machine or groove box. In front of that shelf sits a full-size MIDI keyboard controller. A compact audio mixer and other electronic devices are on the left side of the main surface. Below, a sliding tray supports a beige mechanical keyboard and mouse, and a desktop PC tower sits on the lower shelf. On the floor shelf to the right is a grey laser printer. Numerous cables run under and behind the desk. The room has white walls, a patterned carpet, and a poster with a forest scene partially visible on the right wall.
action.label: response

action.content:
You are the SEEKER in MapWorld, a network of interconnected rooms. Each room is shown to you as an image.

Your objective is to navigate this environment and reach the ESCAPE ROOM.

There can be multiple rooms of the same type (e.g., a MapWorld with 4 rooms may contain 2 visually similar bathrooms).
These rooms might look nearly identical, but not exactly the same.

I only have the image of the ESCAPE ROOM and will describe it to you. I do not know what room you are in, or how your
room's image looks like.

At each step, you will be shown an image of your current room.

You may perform only one of the following actions:

1. If the current room exactly matches the ESCAPE ROOM based on my description, respond strictly with -
ESCAPE

2. If the current room seems similar to the ESCAPE ROOM but you are uncertain, ask me a clarifying question that focuses on visually distinguishing
features that can help you tell your current room apart from the ESCAPE ROOM described.
Respond strictly with -
QUESTION: your question

3. If the current room is definitely not the ESCAPE ROOM, choose a direction from the available options: ['east', 'south']
reply strictly with -
MOVE: chosen direction

Here is the description of the ESCAPE ROOM:
description: a small home music studio setup fills the room. centered on a wooden workstation are two computer monitors: an older beige crt on the left and a flat-panel lcd on the right, both displaying software. large studio monitor speakers stand on black stands at each side, with smaller bookshelf speakers closer to the screens. beneath the monitors rests a shelf holding audio gear, including a rack unit and a drum machine or groove box. in front of that shelf sits a full-size midi keyboard controller. a compact audio mixer and other electronic devices are on the left side of the main surface. below, a sliding tray supports a beige mechanical keyboard and mouse, and a desktop pc tower sits on the lower shelf. on the floor shelf to the right is a grey laser printer. numerous cables run under and behind the desk. the room has white walls, a patterned carpet, and a poster with a forest scene partially visible on the right wall
What action do you choose?

You must follow the above format rules exactly.
Do not respond in any other format. Do not provide any commentary or clarification.
action.label: context
